alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT...EAST CENTRAL DE BACA...SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND SOUTHWESTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM MDT... At 859 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tolar, or 19 miles east of Fort Sumner, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Melrose and Tolar. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 345 and 364. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
